website_summaries.verdict: Unnecessarily wordy, but highly detailed instruction on Olympic-style lifting that will help in getting bigger power lifting gains.
pros: Packed with photographs of lifting techniques
Includes chapters on correcting errors in form, strength programming, and flexibility
Helps lifters of all levels exponentially improve their Olympic lifts
cons: Often too wordy when explaining even simple movements
Geared toward novice and intermediate lifters, less so toward competitive lifters

customer_reviews.title: Still the best information source for American weightlifting...
customer_reviews.text: While its true there is no official standard for American weightlifting, this is the best place to start. So many great coaches started with this material so you might as well do the same. While I'm sure Greg is a very intelligent man, he's not trying to prove it with unnecessary details in the text. This book is well written and easy to understand, for coaches and athletes of all levels. If you're a weightlifting coach, planning to become one, or an athlete looking to take your sport to the next level, I can't recommend this book enough.
customer_reviews.author: James415

customer_reviews.title: THE Bible for Olympic Weightlifting
customer_reviews.text: Fantastic resource from a well respected Olympic lifting coach, author and entrepreneur. Covers all the basics and then some, with great photos and step-by-step progressions, and includes some great sections on mobility, programming, etc. Also has a great section on faults and fixes, which I have gone to a number of times for myself and for others I have coached. This is THE bible for all things olympic lifting related. Gotta have this one on your shelf if you are training or coaching the olympic lifts, or if you are a dedicated CrossFitter.
customer_reviews.author: A. Sherwood

customer_reviews.title: Awesome for a new lifter..
customer_reviews.text: I bought this book in a silly attempt to "teach myself" how to weighlift. I was not disappointed. Greg goes over the lifts extremely well, and he has a great progression for learning them. He warns the new lifter to not read the super in depth description chapter of each lift. Now that I've been at it for a little while, I appreciate this. Those sections make a ton of sense now and definitely would not have at first. He also includes getting ready for a competition and programming. All in all a great purchase as a new lifter!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great read
customer_reviews.text: This is great book and has a complete training guide regardless of where you're at in your training. He adds some GPP workouts but I'd rather add a short CrossFit MetCon and call it a day. This is a great book if you're interested in becoming a lifter or improving your lifts.

customer_reviews.title: THE END ALL, BE ALL book for olympic weightlifting.
customer_reviews.text: Having done weightlifting in college through track and field training, I learned to come to love it. But once I came to love the sport, I began to notice all the little things that I did compared to higher level lifters who were solely dedicated to the sport. With the help of this book and his training programs available on his site, I have been able to turn myself into a more than proficient lifter with great technique. If you are looking for help in becoming more techinal and proficient, then you need not search anymore. This book is THE end all, be all when it comes to being an awesome reference to olympic weightlifting.
